Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti in green faience
Description: This small shabti in green faience was part of the collection É. de Meester de Ravestein. Several characteristics such as the tripartite wig, the facial features, the false beard, the small rucksack on the left shoulder and the dorsal pillar show that the piece dates from the Late Period. The name of the owner, which is written on the bottom of the vertical colomn on the front side of the statuette, poses reading problems.
